Healing Infusion: Curative Admixture.name: Healing Infusion: Curative Admixture
Healing Infusion: Curative Admixture.flavor: You use the magic of your infusion to heal the wounds of your target.
Healing Infusion: Curative Admixture.range: Close burst 5 (10 at 11th level, 15 at 21st level)
Healing Infusion: Curative Admixture.target: You or one ally in the burst
Healing Infusion: Curative Admixture.effect:
The target regains hit points equal to its healing surge value + your Wisdom modifier, and you expend an infusion crafted with your Healing Infusion class feature.
Level 6: Healing surge value + your Wisdom modifier + 2.
Level 11: Healing surge value + your Wisdom modifier + 4.
Level 16: Healing surge value + your Wisdom modifier + 6.
Level 21: Healing surge value + your Wisdom modifier + 8.
Level 26: Healing surge value + your Wisdom modifier + 10.
Healing Infusion: Curative Admixture.special: You can use two Healing Infusion powers per encounter, but only one per round. At 16th level, you can use three Healing Infusion powers per encounter, but only one per round.

Aggravating Force.name: Aggravating Force
Aggravating Force.flavor: When your infused weapon strikes an enemy, the weapon unleashes a force that rattles the foe.
Aggravating Force.onHit:
1[W] + Intelligence modifier force damage, and the next ally to attack the target before the end of your next turn gains a +2 power bonus to the attack roll.
Level 21: 2[W] + Intelligence modifier damage.

Shielding Cube.name: Shielding Cube
Shielding Cube.flavor:
You direct a minute cube covered in runes into the fray. Although
small, the cube contains a force that bashes foes and shields allies.
Shielding Cube.effect: Until the end of your next turn, any ally gains a +1 power bonus to AC while adjacent to the target.

Life-Tapping Darts.name: Life-Tapping Darts
Life-Tapping Darts.flavor: You launch magical darts at an ally and a foe. The dart that strikes the foe transfers vitality to your comrade in a golden flash.
Life-Tapping Darts.onHit: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and one ally within 10 squares of you gains 10 temporary hit points.
Life-Tapping Darts.onMiss: Half damage, and one ally within 10 squares of you gains 5 temporary hit points.

Arcane Springboard.name: Arcane Springboard
Arcane Springboard.flavor: Infusing a small square of prepared cloth with arcane energy, you create a bouncy surface that launches any who step on it.
Arcane Springboard.effect: You conjure an arcane springboard in a square within range. The springboard lasts until the end of your next turn. You or any ally who enters the square can jump a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier. The distance jumped does not count toward a character’s movement. A character can benefit from this conjuration’s effect only once per turn.

Altered Luck.name: Altered Luck
Altered Luck.flavor: Your magic blasts an enemy and transfers its luck to a nearby ally.
Altered Luck.onHit: 1d6 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target takes a –2 penalty to saving throws until the end of your next turn.
Altered Luck.effect: One ally within the burst gains temporary hit points equal to 5 + your Wisdom modifier and a +2 bonus to an attack roll, a skill check, an ability check, or a saving throw before the end of your next turn. The ally can use the bonus after determining the result of a roll.

Predatory Shards.name: Predatory Shards
Predatory Shards.flavor: On impact, your rune-inscribed projectile creates a cloud of magical shards to aggravate your enemies.
Predatory Shards.effect: The burst creates a zone of magical shards that lasts until the end of the encounter. An enemy that starts its turn in the zone takes 5 force damage.

Dancing Weapon.name: Dancing Weapon
Dancing Weapon.flavor: Your weapon flies from your hand and harries one of your enemies.
Dancing Weapon.requirement: You must be holding a melee weapon.
Dancing Weapon.effect: You throw a melee weapon you are holding into an unoccupied square within range. The weapon has speed 0 and fly 6 (hover). The weapon is considered to be a Small creature. When the dancing weapon drops to 0 hit points, it is not destroyed, and you don’t lose a healing surge. Instead, the weapon returns to your hand. The dancing weapon cannot open or close a door or container, or pick up or drop an item. You can give the dancing weapon the following special commands.
Dancing Weapon.minorAction: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. AC; 1[W] + Intelligence modifier damage.
Dancing Weapon.opportunityAttack: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. AC; 1[W] + Intelligence modifier damage.

Regeneration Infusion.name: Regeneration Infusion
Regeneration Infusion.flavor: You imbue an ally’s equipment with a steady flow of arcane energy, which restores your friend’s vigor.
Regeneration Infusion.target: You or one ally in the burst; target must be bloodied
Regeneration Infusion.effect: The target gains regeneration equal to your Constitution modifier until the end of the encounter. As a minor action, the target can end the effect to spend a healing surge.

Phantom Structure.name: Phantom Structure
Phantom Structure.flavor: By arranging small objects in your hand, you create an ephemeral structure made of magical force.
Phantom Structure.effect: Choose a square within range and another square within range and within 2 + your Intelligence modifier squares of the chosen square. You create a phantasmal bridge between the two squares that lasts until the end of your next turn. The bridge connects the two chosen squares by the shortest path. The bridge has no height, and a creature can pass through a square containing the bridge as though it were normal terrain, even if it normally contains no terrain, difficult terrain, challenging terrain, or hindering terrain.

Gale-Force Infusion.name: Gale-Force Infusion
Gale-Force Infusion.flavor: You infuse an ally’s armor with the power of a violent windstorm.
Gale-Force Infusion.range: Area burst 2 centered on an ally within 10 squares of you
Gale-Force Infusion.onHit: 1d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and you slide the target 2 squares.
Gale-Force Infusion.effect: The ally in the attack’s origin square gains a power bonus to AC equal to 2 + your Constitution modifier until the end of your next turn.

Runic Resistance.name: Runic Resistance
Runic Resistance.flavor: Using your implement, you hurl a sigil-scribed sphere that blasts your foes and shields your allies.
Runic Resistance.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier damage. Choose a damage type: acid, cold, fire, or lightning. The attack deals damage of that type to each target.
Runic Resistance.effect: Choose a damage type: acid, cold, fire, or lightning. Each ally in the burst gains resistance equal to 5 + your Wisdom modifier to that type until the end of your next turn.

Lightning Motes.name: Lightning Motes
Lightning Motes.flavor:
Channeling arcane energy into a cloud of dust, you create lightning
that ripples across your foes.
Lightning Motes.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier lightning damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).
Lightning Motes.aftereffect: The target takes ongoing 5 lightning damage (save ends).
Lightning Motes.onMiss: Half damage, and ongoing 5 lightning damage (save ends).

Brittle-Skin Missile.name: Brittle-Skin Missile
Brittle-Skin Missile.flavor: Your rune-scribed projectile calcifies flesh and causes your foe to falter.
Brittle-Skin Missile.onHit: 2[W] + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target is slowed and gains vulnerable 5 to melee attacks (save ends both).
Brittle-Skin Missile.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is slowed (save ends).

Healing Figurine.name: Healing Figurine
Healing Figurine.flavor: You imbue a small figure with life force, causing it to emit a golden aura that heals allies.
Healing Figurine.effect: You create a Small healing figurine in an unoccupied square within range. The healing figurine has speed 5. It has a +2 bonus to AC and to Fortitude. Any ally who spends a healing surge while adjacent to the figurine gains additional hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier. In addition, three times before the end of the encounter, an ally adjacent to the healing figurine can use a minor action to make a saving throw and to regain hit points as if he or she had spent a healing surge. You can give the healing figurine the following special command.
Healing Figurine.minorAction: The healing figurine administers first aid to an ally adjacent to it. The figurine uses your Heal skill for the check.

Barbed Automaton.name: Barbed Automaton
Barbed Automaton.flavor: You hurl a small knot of inscribed barbed wire, which grows and springs to life, attacking your foes.
Barbed Automaton.effect: You create a barbed automaton in an unoccupied square within range. The automaton occupies a square and counts as an ally for the purpose of flanking. The automaton lasts until the end of your next turn. Any enemy that enters a space adjacent to the automaton or starts its turn there is subject to the following attack. An enemy can be attacked in this manner only once per turn.

Forceful Weapon.name: Forceful Weapon
Forceful Weapon.flavor: You infuse a weapon with magic, making it deliver a greater impact than its size suggests.
Forceful Weapon.onHit: 2[W] + Intelligence modifier damage, and you push the target a number of squares equal to your Constitution modifier and knock it prone.

Lightning Sigil.name: Lightning Sigil
Lightning Sigil.flavor: Pouring arcane power into a weapon or implement, you create a crackling field that lashes at foes with tendrils of lightning.
Lightning Sigil.effect: Until the end of the encounter, any attack that uses the target as a weapon or an implement deals extra lightning damage equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier. As a free action, the target’s wielder can end the effect when he or she hits a creature. That creature is then dazed (save ends).

Good Luck Charm.name: Good Luck Charm
Good Luck Charm.flavor: You infuse a small object with luck.
Good Luck Charm.effect: You charge the target with luck that lasts until the end of your next extended rest. Any ally who is holding or wearing the target can expend the charge to gain a bonus equal to your Wisdom modifier to his or her next saving throw or skill check before the end of his or her next turn.

Iron-Hide Infusion.name: Iron-Hide Infusion
Iron-Hide Infusion.flavor: You crush a bit of iron in your hand, infusing it with protective magic. You then cast the dust onto your allies’ armor.
Iron-Hide Infusion.target: You and each ally in the burst
Iron-Hide Infusion.effect: Each target gains a +4 bonus to AC until the end of your next turn.

Skipping Shot.name: Skipping Shot
Skipping Shot.flavor: Infusing a projectile with volatile energy, you send the missile ricocheting among opponents.
Skipping Shot.onHit: 1[W] + Intelligence modifier force damage, and the primary target is dazed until the end of your next turn.
Skipping Shot.secondaryTargets: One creature other than the primary target
Skipping Shot.secondaryOnHit: 1[W] + Intelligence modifier force damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

Earth's Embrace.name: Earth's Embrace
Earth's Embrace.flavor: You transpose a glowing rune of force onto an ally’s armor and send that ally skating across the battle field, crashing into nearby foes.
Earth's Embrace.effect: You slide the primary target a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier. You then make an attack that is an area burst 1 centered on the primary target.
Earth's Embrace.secondaryTarget: Each enemy adjacent to the primary target
Earth's Embrace.onHit: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier force damage, and you slide the secondary target 1 square or immobilize it until the end of your next turn.

Grasping Rope.name: Grasping Rope
Grasping Rope.flavor: Weaving magic into a prepared rope, you transform the object into a whirling, grasping artifice.
Grasping Rope.onHit: 3d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target is immobilized (save ends).
Grasping Rope.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Grasping Rope.effect: The burst creates a zone of grasping rope that lasts until the end of your next turn. The zone is difficult terrain to enemies, and each enemy that enters the zone or starts its turn there is slowed until the end of its next turn.

Burrowing Projectile.name: Burrowing Projectile
Burrowing Projectile.flavor: When your shot strikes a foe, the projectile spins like a top, burrowing into the creature.
Burrowing Projectile.onHit: 3[W] + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target takes ongoing 5 damage and grants combat advantage (save ends both).
Burrowing Projectile.aftereffect: The target takes ongoing 5 damage (save ends). If the target drops to 0 hit points before the ongoing damage ends, you choose an enemy within 5 squares of the target to take ongoing 5 damage (save ends).
Burrowing Projectile.onMiss: Half damage, and the target grants combat advantage (save ends).

Hero's Elixir.name: Hero's Elixir
Hero's Elixir.flavor: You transmute a small vial of water into a potent healing draft.
Hero's Elixir.effect: The target spends one healing surge and is restored to the maximum number of hit points possible. If the target cannot spend a healing surge, the target instead regains hit points equal to his or her bloodied value.

Bag of the Four Winds.name: Bag of the Four Winds
Bag of the Four Winds.flavor: You mix reagents to create a windstorm within a small cloth bag. You then unleash the winds to move yourself and your allies.
Bag of the Four Winds.targets: You and each ally in the burst
Bag of the Four Winds.effect: You slide each target a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Armor of Acid.name: Armor of Acid
Armor of Acid.flavor: You cast a prepared liquid onto an ally’s armor, shrouding that comrade in a cloud of noxious fumes that harms foes.
Armor of Acid.range: Area burst 1 centered on you or one ally within 10 squares
Armor of Acid.effect: Until the end of your next turn, the ally in the attack’s origin square gains resist 15 acid, and any creature that makes a melee attack against that ally takes acid damage equal to 10 + your Wisdom modifier.

Prismatic Strike.name: Prismatic Strike
Prismatic Strike.flavor: You activate runes on your weapon and cause it to emit multicolored light as you strike your foe.
Prismatic Strike.attack: Intelligence vs. Fortitude, Reflex, and Will. You make one attack roll and compare the result against all three defenses. The target might be hit up to three times, depending on which defenses are hit.
Prismatic Strike.onHit (Fortitude): 1[W] + Intelligence modifier thunder damage, and you knock the target prone.
Prismatic Strike.onHit (Reflex): 1[W] + Intelligence modifier force damage, and you push the target a number of squares equal to your Constitution modifier. The target can’t stand up from prone until the end of your next turn.
Prismatic Strike.onHit (Will): 1[W] + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and the target takes a penalty to attack rolls equal to your Wisdom modifier until the end of your next turn.

Trio of Biting Blades.name: Trio of Biting Blades
Trio of Biting Blades.flavor: The three rune-inscribed blades you fling at your opponent surround the creature and bite deep when it attacks or moves.
Trio of Biting Blades.onHit: 3d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target takes 10 damage if it moves or attacks on its turn (save ends).
Trio of Biting Blades.aftereffect: The target takes 10 damage the first time it moves or attacks during its turn (save ends).
Trio of Biting Blades.onMiss: Half damage, and the target takes 5 damage if it moves or attacks on its turn (save ends).

All-Consuming Missile.name: All-Consuming Missile
All-Consuming Missile.flavor: Your sigil-inscribed projectile ignites and engulfs your foe in hungry flames.
All-Consuming Missile.onHit: 3[W] + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and ongoing 10 fire damage (save ends).
All-Consuming Missile.firstFailedSavingThrow: The target takes ongoing 10 fire damage (save ends).
All-Consuming Missile.secondFailedSavingThrow: The target takes ongoing 15 fire damage (save ends).
All-Consuming Missile.onMiss: Half damage, and ongoing 5 fire damage (save ends).

Grave-Dust Cloud.name: Grave-Dust Cloud
Grave-Dust Cloud.flavor: You direct a bag of ash at your foes, and it explodes in a pale cloud that saps their life while bolstering your allies’ vitality.
Grave-Dust Cloud.onHit: 1d10 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage. Each ally in the burst gains a +1 power bonus to attack rolls and to all defenses until the end of your next turn.
Grave-Dust Cloud.effect: Each ally in the burst can spend a healing surge and regain additional hit points equal to 2d6 + your Wisdom modifier.

Living Caltrop Swarm.name: Living Caltrop Swarm
Living Caltrop Swarm.flavor: You direct a handful of spiked orbs across an area. After stinging your foes, the caltrops explode.
Living Caltrop Swarm.effect: The burst creates a zone of animate caltrops that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any enemy within the zone grants combat advantage to you and your allies. Any creature within the zone at the end of your next turn takes fire damage equal to 2d10 + your Wisdom modifier.

Bitter-Frost Bolt.name: Bitter-Frost Bolt
Bitter-Frost Bolt.flavor: The sigils etched onto your weapon steam with bitter cold. On impact, the weapon shrouds your enemy in ice.
Bitter-Frost Bolt.onHit: 3[W] + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and the target is immobilized and gains vulnerable 10 to all damage (save ends both).
Bitter-Frost Bolt.aftereffect: The target is slowed and gains vulnerable 5 to all damage (save ends both).
Bitter-Frost Bolt.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is slowed and gains vulnerable 5 to all damage (save ends both).

Runes of the Shadow Tendrils.name: Runes of the Shadow Tendrils
Runes of the Shadow Tendrils.flavor: Tracing a magic pattern in the air, you cause tentacles of darkness to erupt from your ally’s armor and attack nearby foes.
Runes of the Shadow Tendrils.range: Area burst 1 within 10 squares and centered on one ally
Runes of the Shadow Tendrils.onHit: 4d6 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target is blinded and slowed (save ends both).
Runes of the Shadow Tendrils.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is blinded (save ends).
Runes of the Shadow Tendrils.effect: Until the end of the encounter, any enemy that attacks the ally who was in the attack’s origin square is blinded until the end of your next turn.

Thundering Armor.name: Thundering Armor
Thundering Armor.flavor: Thunder ripples outward from your implement, coalescing around you or an ally before focusing its might on a nearby enemy.
Thundering Armor.primaryTarget: You or one ally in the burst
Thundering Armor.effect: The primary target gains a +1 power bonus to AC until the end of your next turn.  Make an attack.
Thundering Armor.secondaryTarget: One creature adjacent to the primary target in the burst
Thundering Armor.onHit:
1d8 + Intelligence modifier thunder damage, and you push the secondary target 1 square away from the primary target.
Level 21: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier thunder damage.

Spike Wire.name: Spike Wire
Spike Wire.flavor:
You throw a bundle of barbed wire that bites into your enemy’s
flesh, digging deeper and deeper.
Spike Wire.onHit: 1d8 + Intelligence modifier force damage. Until the end of your next turn, any attack deals extra damage to the target equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Caustic Rampart.name: Caustic Rampart
Caustic Rampart.flavor:
You spill some liquid and infuse it with energy, creating a defensive
wall of acidic fumes.
Caustic Rampart.effect: You conjure a wall of acidic fumes.  The wall can be up to 2 squares high and must rest on a solid surface, and it lasts until the end of your next turn.  The wall is difficult terrain, and its squares are lightly obscured.  Any creature that starts its turn within the wall or adjacent to it takes acid damage equal to 1d6 + your Intelligence modifier.

Restorative Infusion.name: Restorative Infusion
Restorative Infusion.flavor: You infuse a comrade with a restorative compound. That ally can then redirect excess vitality to your other allies.
Restorative Infusion.effect: The target gains 20 temporary hit points. As a minor action, the target can transfer any number of these temporary hit points to an ally within 5 squares of him or her.

Slick Concoction.name: Slick Concoction
Slick Concoction.flavor: You direct a magical liquid under your allies’ feet, causing them to slip across the battle field.
Slick Concoction.effect: You slide each target 5 squares. Each target gains a +4 bonus to Reflex until the end of your next turn.

Magic Weapon.name: Magic Weapon
Magic Weapon.flavor: Your attack issues a burst of magical energy that enhances the weapons of allies close to you.
Magic Weapon.onHit:
1[W] + Intelligence modifier damage, and each ally adjacent to you gains a +1 power bonus to attack rolls and a power bonus to damage rolls equal to your Constitution modifier or your Wisdom modifier until the end of your next turn.
Level 21: 2[W] + Intelligence modifier damage, and a +2 power bonus to attack rolls.

Unbalancing Force.name: Unbalancing Force
Unbalancing Force.flavor: You point your implement and blast a foe so that it reels from your ally’s attack.
Unbalancing Force.onHit:
1d8 + Intelligence modifier force damage. The next ally who hits the target before the end of your next turn also pushes the target 1 square.
Level 21: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier force damage.

Punishing Eye.name: Punishing Eye
Punishing Eye.flavor:
An arcane construct of an eye appears in the air, revealing
your enemies and striking them when they show weaknesses.
Punishing Eye.effect: You conjure an eye in a square within range. It lasts until the end of the encounter. Enemies within 3 squares of the eye do not benefit from concealment, and when an ally attacks an enemy within 3 squares of the eye and hits, that enemy takes psychic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier. You can move the eye 3 squares as a move action.

Healing Infusion: Resistive Formula.name: Healing Infusion: Resistive Formula
Healing Infusion: Resistive Formula.flavor: You channel the energy of your infusion into your target’s armor, providing lasting protection.
Healing Infusion: Resistive Formula.range: Close burst 5 (10 at 11th level, 15 at 21st level)
Healing Infusion: Resistive Formula.target: You or one ally in the burst
Healing Infusion: Resistive Formula.effect:
The target gains a +1 power bonus to AC until the end of the encounter, and you expend an infusion crafted with your Healing Infusion class feature. The target can end the bonus as a free action to gain temporary hit points equal to its healing surge value + your Constitution modifier.
Level 11: Temporary hit points equal to the target’s healing surge value + twice your Constitution modifier.
Level 21: Temporary hit points equal to the target’s healing surge value + three times your Constitution modifier.
Healing Infusion: Resistive Formula.special: You can use two Healing Infusion powers per encounter, but only one per round. At 16th level, you can use three Healing Infusion powers per encounter, but only one per round.

Static Shock.name: Static Shock
Static Shock.flavor: You imbue your opponent with a crackling arcane charge, hindering the potency of its next attack.
Static Shock.onHit:
1d8 + Intelligence modifier lightning damage. The next attack the target makes before the end of your next turn takes a penalty to the damage roll equal your Constitution modifier.
Level 21: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier lightning damage.

Burning Weapons.name: Burning Weapons
Burning Weapons.flavor: Flames dance across the weapons that you and your comrades wield.
Burning Weapons.onHit: 1[W] + Intelligence modifier fire damage. Until the end of your next turn, you and any ally within 2 squares of you deals extra fire damage equal to your Constitution modifier with weapon or fire attacks.

Scouring Weapon.name: Scouring Weapon
Scouring Weapon.flavor: You infuse your weapon with acid, momentarily corroding your opponent’s defenses.
Scouring Weapon.onHit: 2[W] + Intelligence modifier acid damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to AC until the end of your next turn.

Icebound Sigil.name: Icebound Sigil
Icebound Sigil.flavor: By etching an arcane sigil upon a weapon, you infuse it with icy cold, giving it the power to freeze foes.
Icebound Sigil.effect:
Until the end of the encounter, any attack that uses the target as a weapon or an implement deals extra cold damage equal to your Constitution modifier.
As a free action, the target’s wielder can end the effect when he or she hits a creature. That creature is then immobilized (save ends).

Obedient Servant.name: Obedient Servant
Obedient Servant.flavor: You infuse a construct with an elemental animus and then throw it into the fray to aid your allies.
Obedient Servant.effect: You create a Medium obedient servant in an unoccupied square within range. The servant has speed 6. Any marked enemy that starts its turn adjacent to the servant takes damage equal to your Wisdom modifier. You can give the obedient servant the following special commands.
Obedient Servant.standardAction: Melee 1 or Ranged 5; targets one creature; Intelligence + 2 vs. AC; 1d10 + Intelligence modifier damage.
Obedient Servant.opportunityAttack: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence + 2 vs. AC; 1d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target is marked until the end of your next turn.

Bolster Armor.name: Bolster Armor
Bolster Armor.flavor: You touch some armor, causing it to glow as you enhance its defenses.
Bolster Armor.effect: The target gains a +1 power bonus to AC until the end of the encounter. When hit by an attack, the target can end this bonus as a free action to gain a +4 bonus to AC against that attack.

Reinforced Minion.name: Reinforced Minion
Reinforced Minion.flavor: You send energy to bolster one of your artifices, helping it to evade an attack that might otherwise have damaged it.
Reinforced Minion.trigger: One of your summoned creatures within 5 squares of you is hit by an attack
Reinforced Minion.effect: The triggering attack misses the summoned creature.

Swift Mender.name: Swift Mender
Swift Mender.flavor: You empower a tiny construct to zoom to an ally’s aid.
Swift Mender.effect: The target makes a saving throw.

Use Magic Item.name: Use Magic Item
Use Magic Item.flavor: Your knowledge unlocks the power in a magic item without expending your own energy.
Use Magic Item.effect: The next magic item daily power you use before the end of your next turn does not count toward your limit of magic item daily power uses.

Force Infusion.name: Force Infusion
Force Infusion.flavor: Your attack binds energy within your foe’s form. The magic reacts with concussive force each time you or an ally strikes the creature.
Force Infusion.onHit: 1[W] + Intelligence modifier + Constitution modifier force damage.
Force Infusion.effect: Until the end of your next turn, whenever any ally hits the target with a melee attack, that ally pushes the target 1 square.

Lightning Sphere.name: Lightning Sphere
Lightning Sphere.flavor: The small metal ball you roll at your enemies bursts apart in an explosion of lightning.
Lightning Sphere.onHit: 1d8 + Intelligence modifier lightning damage, and the target grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.

Repulsion Strike.name: Repulsion Strike
Repulsion Strike.flavor: You empower your weapon to create a field of resistance around your enemy, hindering your foe’s attacks.
Repulsion Strike.onHit: 2[W] + Intelligence modifier force damage, and the target takes a penalty to melee attack rolls equal to your Constitution modifier until the end of your next turn.

Corrosive Sigil.name: Corrosive Sigil
Corrosive Sigil.flavor: Your sigil imbues a weapon or an implement with arcane acid.
Corrosive Sigil.effect:
Until the end of the encounter, any attack that uses the target as a weapon deals ongoing 5 acid damage (save ends).
As a free action, the target’s wielder can end the effect when he or she hits a creature using the target in order to give that creature a penalty to AC equal to your Constitution modifier (save ends).

Flameheart Defender.name: Flameheart Defender
Flameheart Defender.flavor: You infuse a small construct with a volatile heart of elemental fire.
Flameheart Defender.effect: You create a Small flameheart defender in an unoccupied square within range. The flameheart defender has speed 6. Any enemy adjacent to the flameheart defender at the start of your turn is marked by it. You can give the flameheart defender the following special commands.
Flameheart Defender.standardAction: Melee 1 or Ranged 5; targets one creature; Intelligence + 2 vs. AC; 2d6 + Intelligence modifier fire damage.
Flameheart Defender.opportunityAttack: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence + 2 vs. AC; 2d6 + Intelligence modifier fire damage.
Flameheart Defender.noAction: When the flameheart defender drops to 0 hit points, it must make the following attack: Close burst 2; targets each creature in the burst; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 1d8 + Wisdom modifier fire damage.

Animate Helper.name: Animate Helper
Animate Helper.flavor: You’ ve crafted the perfect assistant for your task.
Animate Helper.effect: You gain a bonus to your next skill check before the end of your turn equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Healing Reserve.name: Healing Reserve
Healing Reserve.flavor: You channel arcane energy to assist an ally’s healing.
Healing Reserve.trigger: An ally within 10 squares of you spends a healing surge to regain hit points.
Healing Reserve.effect: The target does not expend the healing surge but still gains its benefit. The target regains additional hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Icy Weapons.name: Icy Weapons
Icy Weapons.flavor: An icy wind imbues your weapon with frost.
Icy Weapons.onHit: 1[W] + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Icy Weapons.effect: You and each ally adjacent to you deal extra cold damage equal to your Constitution modifier with weapon or cold attacks until the end of your next turn.

Vampiric Weapons.name: Vampiric Weapons
Vampiric Weapons.flavor: You imbue your weapon with the power to drain life from your enemies and transfer it to the weapons of your allies.
Vampiric Weapons.onHit: 1[W] + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage. Each ally within 5 squares of you who deals damage with a weapon attack before the end of your next turn regains hit points equal to 1d6 + your Constitution modifier. An ally regains these hit points only once for each use of this power.

Radiant Sigil.name: Radiant Sigil
Radiant Sigil.flavor: Brilliant light streams from the weapon you imbue with radiant might and healing power.
Radiant Sigil.effect:
Until the end of the encounter, any attack that uses the target as a weapon or an implement deals radiant damage. Whenever any attack power using the target hits, the target’s wielder regains hit points equal to your Constitution modifier.
As a free action, the target’s wielder can end the effect when he or she hits a creature. That creature is then dazed (save ends). In addition, the wielder can spend a healing surge and regain additional hit points equal to your Constitution modifier.

Relentless Harrier.name: Relentless Harrier
Relentless Harrier.flavor: You grant animation to a nimble construct.
Relentless Harrier.effect: You create a Small relentless harrier in an unoccupied square within range. The relentless harrier has speed 8. The relentless harrier’s attacks deal 1d6 extra damage to any creature granting combat advantage to it. You can give the relentless harrier the following special commands.
Relentless Harrier.standardAction: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence + 2 vs. AC; 1d8 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the relentless harrier shifts 2 squares.
Relentless Harrier.opportunityAttack: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence + 2 vs. AC; 1d8 + Intelligence modifier damage.

Dancing Shield.name: Dancing Shield
Dancing Shield.flavor: A small metal sheaf unfolds into a medium-sized shield that floats near an ally and blocks incoming attacks.
Dancing Shield.effect: You conjure a shield of metal and magic to protect the target. The target gains a +4 power bonus to AC and Reflex until the end of the encounter or until you move the shield. As a minor action, you can move the shield to a new target within range. That ally then gains the bonus.

Sigil of Luck.name: Sigil of Luck
Sigil of Luck.flavor: You imbue a weapon or an implement with a dose of luck and arcane energy.
Sigil of Luck.effect: Until the end of the encounter, any attack that uses the target gains a +1 power bonus to attack rolls and a bonus to damage rolls equal to your Constitution modifier. As a minor action, the target’s wielder can end the effect in order to remove an effect on him or her that a save can end.

Energy Shroud.name: Energy Shroud
Energy Shroud.flavor: A field of arcane energy surrounds you and your allies, lashing at attackers.
Energy Shroud.primaryTarget: You and each ally in the burst
Energy Shroud.effect: Until the end of your next turn, any enemy that hits or misses the primary target with a melee attack is subject to the following attack.

Positive Energy Infusion.name: Positive Energy Infusion
Positive Energy Infusion.flavor: You channel arcane power into your enemy, using the creature as a conduit for vitality.
Positive Energy Infusion.onHit: 2[W] + Intelligence modifier damage. Until the end of your next turn, any ally who hits the target can spend a healing surge and regain additional hit points equal to your Constitution modifier.

Animate Arbalester.name: Animate Arbalester
Animate Arbalester.flavor: Your crossbow glows briefly as you infuse it with elemental life force. The weapon then alights, moving as you will it.
Animate Arbalester.requirement: You must be holding a crossbow.
Animate Arbalester.effect: You throw a crossbow you are holding into an unoccupied square within range. The crossbow has speed 0 and fly 6 (hover). The crossbow is considered to be a Small creature. When the animate arbalester drops to 0 hit points, it is not destroyed, and you don’t lose a healing surge. Instead, the crossbow returns to your hand. The animate arbalester cannot open or close a door or container, or pick up or drop an item. You can give the animate arbalester the following special command.
Animate Arbalester.minorAction: Ranged 15/30; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. AC; 2[W] + Intelligence modifier damage.

Clockroach Swarm.name: Clockroach Swarm
Clockroach Swarm.flavor: You unleash a horde of tiny constructs that swarm over and bite your foes.
Clockroach Swarm.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier damage, and ongoing 5 damage (save ends).
Clockroach Swarm.effect: You create a zone of tiny mechanical cockroaches that lasts until the end of the encounter. Any enemy within the zone grants combat advantage.

Stalwart Defender.name: Stalwart Defender
Stalwart Defender.flavor: You animate a small construct covered in armored plates.
Stalwart Defender.effect: You create a Small stalwart defender in an unoccupied square within range. The stalwart defender has speed 6 and a +2 bonus to AC. Any enemy that starts its turn adjacent to the stalwart defender is marked by the defender until the end of your next turn. You can give the stalwart defender the following special commands.
Stalwart Defender.standardAction: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence + 2 vs. AC; 2d8 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.
Stalwart Defender.opportunityAttack: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence + 2 vs. AC; 2d8 + Intelligence modifier damage.

Protection from Elements.name: Protection from Elements
Protection from Elements.flavor: You direct a vibrant ray of protective energy at an ally, granting resistance to that comrade and to those around him or her.
Protection from Elements.effect: Choose a damage type: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. The target gains resist 15 to that damage type until the end of the encounter. In addition, while you or any ally is adjacent to the target, you or that ally gains resist 10 to the chosen damage type.

Vorpal Edge.name: Vorpal Edge
Vorpal Edge.flavor: The deadly parts of the weapon you touch become suffused with magic, making them sharper and deadlier.
Vorpal Edge.effect: Until the end of the encounter, attacks with the target score critical hits on rolls of 18 or higher.

Radiant Burst.name: Radiant Burst
Radiant Burst.flavor: As your ally heals, you channel the excess healing energy into a flash of arcane light that burns a nearby foe.
Radiant Burst.effect: You or one ally within 10 squares of you can spend a healing surge and regain additional hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Radiant Burst.target: One creature adjacent to the character who spent the healing surge
Radiant Burst.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier radiant damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

Unstable Infusion.name: Unstable Infusion
Unstable Infusion.flavor: You sabotage one of your infusions, loosing a blast of raw arcane energy.
Unstable Infusion.onHit: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and you knock the target prone.

Clockwork Acid Wasp.name: Clockwork Acid Wasp
Clockwork Acid Wasp.flavor: You grant animation to a clockwork wasp fueled by acid.
Clockwork Acid Wasp.effect: You create a Small clockwork acid wasp in an unoccupied square within range. The wasp has speed 4 and fly 8 (hover). It has a +2 bonus to AC and to Reflex. When the clockwork wasp drops to 0 hit points, you don’t lose a healing surge. You can give the clockwork acid wasp the following special commands.
Clockwork Acid Wasp.standardAction: Melee 1 or Ranged 5; Intelligence + 2 vs. AC; 1d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and ongoing 10 acid damage (save ends).
Clockwork Acid Wasp.opportunityAttack: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence + 2 vs. AC; 1d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and ongoing 10 acid damage (save ends).
Clockwork Acid Wasp.noAction: When the clockwork acid wasp drops to 0 hit points, it must make the following attack: Close burst 1; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 2d8 + Wisdom modifier acid damage.

Hellfire Sigil.name: Hellfire Sigil
Hellfire Sigil.flavor: Flames dance upon the surface of the item you infuse with magic, eager to incinerate your foes.
Hellfire Sigil.effect:
Until the end of the encounter, any attack that uses the target as a weapon or an implement deals extra fire damage equal to 1d8 + your Constitution modifier.
As a free action, the target’s wielder can end the effect when he or she hits a creature using the target in order to ignite that creature with hellfire (save ends). While affected by hellfire, the target takes 10 fire damage at the start of its turn. In addition, any enemy within 2 squares of the target at the start of its turn takes 10 fire damage.

Cure-All Admixture.name: Cure-All Admixture
Cure-All Admixture.flavor: Your concoction provides the perfect remedy.
Cure-All Admixture.effect: The target regains hit points as if he or she had spent a healing surge, and the target can choose to end any effects on him or her. In addition, the target gains a +2 power bonus to saving throws until the end of the encounter.

Diminutive Bodyguard.name: Diminutive Bodyguard
Diminutive Bodyguard.flavor: With a burst of magic, you infuse inanimate components with life, creating a tiny construct that can intercept attacks.
Diminutive Bodyguard.effect: You create a Small diminutive bodyguard in an unoccupied square within range. The bodyguard has speed 3. It has a +2 bonus to AC and a +4 bonus to Fortitude, Reflex, and Will. Any ally adjacent to the diminutive bodyguard gains resist 5 to all damage. You can give the diminutive bodyguard the following special command.
Diminutive Bodyguard.immediateInterrupt: When an ally within 5 squares of the diminutive bodyguard is hit by an attack, the ally gains a +4 bonus to all defenses against the triggering attack.

Beetle of Force.name: Beetle of Force
Beetle of Force.flavor: You release a tiny construct, which flies into your foe with impossible force before exploding with arcane energy.
Beetle of Force.onHit: 1d8 + Intelligence modifier force damage, and you push the primary target 6 squares.
Beetle of Force.effect: Make a secondary attack that is an area burst 2 centered on the primary target.
Beetle of Force.secondaryOnHit: 1d8 + Intelligence modifier damage, and you knock the secondary target prone.

Chaos Weapon.name: Chaos Weapon
Chaos Weapon.flavor: With your strike, you conjure elemental powers that rage around the weapons of you and your allies.
Chaos Weapon.onHit: 2[W] + Intelligence modifier damage. Choose a damage type: acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, or thunder. The attack deals damage of this type to the target. Until the end of your next turn, the weapon attacks of each ally within 2 squares of you deal extra damage of the chosen type equal to 1d8 + your Constitution modifier.

Dimensional Shifter.name: Dimensional Shifter
Dimensional Shifter.flavor: You bind a powerful elemental to your construct, giving the artifice the power to alter space around it.
Dimensional Shifter.effect: You create a Small dimensional shifter in an unoccupied square within range. The dimensional shifter has speed 6 and can teleport 6 squares as a move action. If the dimensional shifter and one of your allies are adjacent to an enemy, that enemy grants combat advantage to all creatures adjacent to it. You can give the dimensional shifter the following special commands.
Dimensional Shifter.standardAction: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence + 2 vs. AC; 2d8 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the dimensional shifter teleports 3 squares.
Dimensional Shifter.opportunityAttack: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence + 2 vs. AC; 2d8 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the dimensional shifter teleports the target 3 squares.

Life-Shock Sigil.name: Life-Shock Sigil
Life-Shock Sigil.flavor: Through your infusion, you create a weapon that heals while it hurts.
Life-Shock Sigil.effect:
Until the end of the encounter, once per round when an attack that uses the target as a weapon or an implement hits, one bloodied ally within 5 squares of the target’s wielder regains hit points equal to 10 + your Constitution modifier.
As a free action, the target’s wielder can end the effect when he or she hits a creature using the target in order to spend a healing surge. In addition, the target of that attack is stunned until the end of its next turn.

Life-Stealing Shroud.name: Life-Stealing Shroud
Life-Stealing Shroud.flavor: A gray field of necrotic energy surrounds you and your allies, stealing the life of attackers.
Life-Stealing Shroud.primaryTarget: You and each ally in the burst
Life-Stealing Shroud.effect: Until the end of your next turn, any enemy that hits or misses the primary target with a melee attack is subject to the following attack.
Life-Stealing Shroud.onHit: 4d6 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and the primary target who was attacked can make a saving throw.

Thunder-Shock Weapon.name: Thunder-Shock Weapon
Thunder-Shock Weapon.flavor: Your weapon screams like a hurricane as you swing it toward your foe. It strikes with a thunderous blow, knocking your foe down.
Thunder-Shock Weapon.onHit: 3[W] + Intelligence modifier thunder damage, and you knock the target prone. The target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

Haste Sigil.name: Haste Sigil
Haste Sigil.flavor: The runes you inscribe on the item cause its wielder to move in a blur of speed.
Haste Sigil.effect:
Until the end of the encounter, the creature wielding the target gains a +3 power bonus to speed.
As a free action, the target’s wielder can end the effect when he or she hits a creature using the target in order to take an extra standard action.

Simulacrum.name: Simulacrum
Simulacrum.flavor: You use magic and elemental life force to fashion a construct capable of sophisticated attacks.
Simulacrum.effect: You create a Medium simulacrum in an unoccupied square within range. The simulacrum has whatever speed and modes of movement you have without bonuses or penalties. The simulacrum has nonmagical copies of any implements or weapons you possessed at the time of its creation. These disappear when this power ends or when they are removed from the simulacrum. You can give the simulacrum the following special commands.
Simulacrum.standardAction: The simulacrum uses an artificer daily attack power that you know, regardless of whether you’ve already expended that power. The simulacrum cannot use simulacrum. The simulacrum’s use of a daily attack power does not count toward your use of that power. The simulacrum uses your attack bonus with the power. After the simulacrum uses a daily attack power, simulacrum ends.
Simulacrum.opportunityAttack: The simulacrum uses your melee basic attack when making opportunity attacks.

Healing Infusion: Shielding Elixir.name: Healing Infusion: Shielding Elixir
Healing Infusion: Shielding Elixir.flavor: You carefully prepare a formula that inoculates your target’s body against damage of a certain type.
Healing Infusion: Shielding Elixir.range: Close burst 5 (10 at 11th level, 15 at 21st level)
Healing Infusion: Shielding Elixir.target: You or one ally in the burst
Healing Infusion: Shielding Elixir.effect:
The target gains resist 5 to one of the following damage types until the end of the encounter: cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, radiant, or thunder. The target can end the bonus as a free action to become immune to that damage type until the end of his or her next turn.
Level 11: Resist 10.
Level 21: Resist 15.
Healing Infusion: Shielding Elixir.special: You can use two Healing Infusion powers per encounter, but only one per round. At 16th level, you can use three Healing Infusion powers per encounter, but only one per round.

Ethereal Chill.name: Ethereal Chill
Ethereal Chill.flavor: You align your spell with those you wove over your ally’s armor, causing them to radiate an unnatural cold.
Ethereal Chill.range: Area burst 1 centered on an ally within 5 squares
Ethereal Chill.onHit:
1d8 + Intelligence modifier cold damage. Until the end of your next turn, any enemy that hits the ally takes cold damage equal to your Wisdom modifier.
Level 21: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier cold damage.

Drain Speed.name: Drain Speed
Drain Speed.flavor: You bind the quickness of your enemy to the enchantments you placed on your ally, transferring speed from one to the other.
Drain Speed.onHit: 1d10 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn. Choose one ally within 5 squares of the target; that ally gains a +2 bonus to speed until the end of your next turn and also gains 5 temporary hit points.

Halo of Thorns.name: Halo of Thorns
Halo of Thorns.flavor: You enchant your ammunition with poisoning magic, then transfer that enchantment onto one of your allies close to the target.
Halo of Thorns.onHit: 2[W] + Intelligence modifier poison damage, and choose one ally within 5 squares of the target. Until the end of your next turn, any creature that hits that ally with a melee attack takes poison damage equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Flameburst Armor.name: Flameburst Armor
Flameburst Armor.flavor: You inscribe a fiery rune upon your ally’s armor or garments, then turn a fire spirit loose on the field of battle as you flare the rune periodically.

bonusPower.name: Flameburst Armor Attack
bonusPower.range: Close burst 1 centered on the ally you targeted with fireburst armor
bonusPower.requirement: The power Fireburst Armor must be active in order to use this power.
bonusPower.special: You can use this power only once per turn.
bonusPower.effect: The secondary target takes fire damage equal to 5 + your implement’s enhancement bonus and is marked by the primary target until the end of your next turn.

Flameburst Armor.effect: You infuse the target’s armor with an elemental fire spirit. Until the end of the encounter, the target gains resist 5 fire. In addition, you can use the Fireburst Armor Attack power once per round until the end of the encounter if the primary target is within 5 squares of you.

War Proxy.name: War Proxy
War Proxy.flavor: You forge an arcane bond between your weapon and your ally, causing your attacks to spring forth from small portals that appear next to your ally.
War Proxy.range: Close burst 3, centered on an ally within 5 squares
War Proxy.effect: Until the end of the encounter, if the ally is within 10 squares of you and you have line of effect to the ally, you can use that ally as the origin square for your ranged weapon attacks.

Arcane Anchor.name: Arcane Anchor
Arcane Anchor.flavor: You trigger latent enchantments placed on yourself or an ally to resist being pushed around the area.
Arcane Anchor.trigger: You or an ally are affected by a push, pull, or slide effect

Shocking Feedback.name: Shocking Feedback
Shocking Feedback.flavor: You quickly fire an enchanted shot at an attacking enemy, then cause the magic from the enchantment to leap onto your ally as a protective ward.
Shocking Feedback.trigger: An enemy hits and deals damage to one of your allies with an attack
Shocking Feedback.onHit: 2[W] + Intelligence modifier lightning damage, and the ally hit gains resist 5 all until the end of your next turn.

Hypnotic Distraction.name: Hypnotic Distraction
Hypnotic Distraction.flavor: The runes carved on your armor and implement flow hypnotically, drawing the attention of one of your enemies.
Hypnotic Distraction.onHit: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target takes a penalty to attack rolls equal to your Wisdom modifier until the end of your next turn.

Warweaver's Tether.name: Warweaver's Tether
Warweaver's Tether.flavor: You trigger the enchantments on your ally’s armor, opening up a connection between you and that ally that bends space with arcane power.
Warweaver's Tether.special: Choose one ally within 5 squares of you. That ally’s square is the point of origin for this attack.
Warweaver's Tether.onHit: 3[W] + Intelligence modifier force damage, and you push the target a number of squares equal to 1 + your Wisdom modifier.
Warweaver's Tether.onMiss: Half damage, and you push the target 2 squares.
Warweaver's Tether.effect: You teleport into an unoccupied square adjacent to the ally you chose for warweaver’s tether, provided that the ally is within 10 squares of you.
Warweaver's Tether.requirement: The power Warweaver's Tether must be active in order to use this power.

Thunderclap Armor.name: Thunderclap Armor
Thunderclap Armor.flavor: You conjure a minor thunder elemental, binding it to your ally’s armor while retaining control of its arcane power.
Thunderclap Armor.effect: You infuse the target’s armor with an elemental thunder spirit. Until the end of the encounter, the target gains resist 5 thunder, and any enemy that ends its turn adjacent to the target takes 5 thunder damage. In addition, you can use the Thunderclap Armor Attack power once per round until the end of the encounter if the primary target is within 5 squares of you.
Thunderclap Armor.requirement: The power Thunderclap Armor must be active in order to use this power.
Thunderclap Armor.secondaryOnHit: 1d10 + Intelligence modifier thunder damage, and you push the secondary target 2 squares from the primary target.

Energy Conversion.name: Energy Conversion
Energy Conversion.flavor: Your spell absorbs the energy of your enemy’s attacks, turning it into a protective ward for your ally.
Energy Conversion.trigger: An ally takes damage from an attack
Energy Conversion.effect: The target gains resist all equal to 5 + your Wisdom modifier against the triggering attack. After the attack is resolved, the ally gains temporary hit points equal 5 + your Wisdom modifier.

Debilitating Intercession.name: Debilitating Intercession
Debilitating Intercession.flavor: You fire a snap shot at an attacking enemy in retribution for an attack, then transfer the energy from your attack to create a weakening ward around your ally.
Debilitating Intercession.trigger: An enemy hits and deals damage to one of your allies with an attack
Debilitating Intercession.onHit: 2[W] + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and until the end of your next turn any enemy takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls while adjacent to the ally.

Sphere of Reality.name: Sphere of Reality
Sphere of Reality.flavor: You hurl a glass orb that warps reality when it cracks open, blasting your enemy and opening a rift through which you can attack.
Sphere of Reality.onHit: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier thunder damage, and choose a square adjacent to the target. Until the end of your next turn, you can treat that square as the point of origin of your attacks.

Healer's Momentum.name: Healer's Momentum
Healer's Momentum.flavor: You draw upon the force of your enemy’s attacks, transforming them into a curative infusion on the fly.
Healer's Momentum.trigger: An enemy deals damage with an attack to one of your allies within 5 squares of you
Healer's Momentum.effect: The ally hit by the triggering attack roll can spend a healing surge. Two other allies within 5 squares of the target gain temporary hit points equal to their healing surge value.

Static Shell.name: Static Shell
Static Shell.flavor: You create an enchantment of arcane static that you lay of your ally’s armor.
Static Shell.effect: You infuse the target’s armor with a static charge. Until the end of the encounter, the target gains resist 5 lightning. In addition, you can use the Static Shell Attack power once per round until the end of the encounter if the primary target is within 5 squares of you.
Static Shell.requirement: The power Static Shell must be active in order to use this power.
Static Shell.secondaryOnHit: 1d10 + Intelligence modifier lightning damage, and you pull the secondary target 1 square to a space adjacent to the primary target.

Recuperative Enchantment.name: Recuperative Enchantment
Recuperative Enchantment.flavor: You trigger enchantments placed on your ally’s armor that temporarily infuses them with healing energy.
Recuperative Enchantment.trigger: An ally in range spends a healing surge
Recuperative Enchantment.effect: The target heals additional hit points equal to his or her healing surge value.

Bond of Transference.name: Bond of Transference
Bond of Transference.flavor: You create an arcane connection between an enemy and your ally, drawing effects from your ally to your enemy.
Bond of Transference.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier force damage, and choose one ally within 5 squares of the target. If that ally has any effects on him or her that a save can end, end one such effect on that ally and the target gains that same effect until the end of your next turn.

Wind of Swirling Flames.name: Wind of Swirling Flames
Wind of Swirling Flames.flavor: A burning wind flows behind your arrow as it streaks away from you, then swirls around your target, drawing your allies closer.
Wind of Swirling Flames.onHit: 3[W] + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and choose one ally within 5 squares of the target. Until the end of your next turn, that ally can shift 1 square as a minor action, as long as that shift does not take the ally farther away from the target.

Ice Archon's Armor.name: Ice Archon's Armor
Ice Archon's Armor.flavor: You bind a fragment of an ice archon’s power to your ally’s armor, transforming it into similar armor.
Ice Archon's Armor.effect: You infuse the target’s armor with an elemental cold spirit. Until the end of the encounter, the ally gains resist 10 cold, and any enemy that starts its turn adjacent to the target gains vulnerable 5 cold damage until the start of its next turn. In addition, you can use the Ice Archon's Armor Attack power once per round until the end of the encounter if the primary target is within 5 squares of you.
Ice Archon's Armor.requirement: The power Ice Archon's Armor must be active in order to use this power.
Ice Archon's Armor.secondaryOnHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.

Spellmaster's Pawn.name: Spellmaster's Pawn
Spellmaster's Pawn.flavor: You bond your own weapon to the enchantments you placed on your allies, causing your attacks to emanate from them.
Spellmaster's Pawn.range: Close burst 3 centered on an ally within 10 squares
Spellmaster's Pawn.requirement: You must be wielding a ranged weapon.
Spellmaster's Pawn.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you can choose to use the ally you chose for this power as the point of origin for all your arcane ranged attack powers.

Dimensional Mooring.name: Dimensional Mooring
Dimensional Mooring.flavor: You use the enchantments on your ally’s armor to moor him or her to your current plane, making him or her a part of the fabric of reality.
Dimensional Mooring.target: You or one ally in range
Dimensional Mooring.effect: The target cannot be pushed, pulled, slid, knocked prone, or teleported against its will until the end of your next turn.

Addling Pattern.name: Addling Pattern
Addling Pattern.flavor: You weave an enchantment over your allies’ armor that confuses foes, causing them to attack their friends.
Addling Pattern.target: One or two enemies in the blast
Addling Pattern.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and until the end of your next turn if the target attacks you or an ally adjacent to you, the target must also make a basic attack against a creature of your choice.

Arsenal Transference.name: Arsenal Transference
Arsenal Transference.flavor: You lend your arcane knowledge to an ally, briefly letting him or her make use of your enchantments.
Arsenal Transference.trigger: An ally within 10 squares of you is hit and damaged by an attack
Arsenal Transference.effect: You can use an at-will artificer attack power against the target, using the ally’s space as the origin for the attack. This attack deals extra damage equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Planestorm Anchor.name: Planestorm Anchor
Planestorm Anchor.flavor: You weave enchantments used by powerful planeswalkers over your ally, transforming them into a focal point for teleportation.
Planestorm Anchor.onHit: 3[W] + Intelligence modifier lightning and thunder damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).
Planestorm Anchor.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.
Planestorm Anchor.effect: You teleport into an unoccupied space adjacent to the chosen ally and make the following secondary attack.
Planestorm Anchor.requirement: The power Planestorm Anchor must be active in order to use this power.
Planestorm Anchor.secondaryOnHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier lightning and thunder damage.

Opportunistic Enchantment.name: Opportunistic Enchantment
Opportunistic Enchantment.flavor: You quickly trigger the enchantments on your ally’s weapons, altering their attack.
Opportunistic Enchantment.trigger: A creature provokes an opportunity attack from one of your allies within range
Opportunistic Enchantment.target: The ally making the opportunity attack
Opportunistic Enchantment.effect: The target can roll twice for the attack roll, keeping either result, and you choose one damage type: cold, fire, force, lightning, or thunder. If the ally’s opportunity attack hits, the attack deals damage of that type, instead of any damage type it normally deals.

Mental Beacon.name: Mental Beacon
Mental Beacon.flavor: You transform something your enemy is carrying or wearing into a psychic beacon that calls out for your allies’ attacks.
Mental Beacon.onHit: 3d8 + Intelligence modifier damage, and until the end of your next turn each time one of your allies makes a ranged attack against the target, the ally can roll twice and keep either result.

Rejuvenating Intercession.name: Rejuvenating Intercession
Rejuvenating Intercession.flavor: You flare the enchantments on your ally, damaging their attacker and transferring rejuvenating energy to the ally.
Rejuvenating Intercession.trigger: An enemy hits and deals damage to one of your allies with an attack
Rejuvenating Intercession.onHit: 2[W] + Intelligence modifier damage, and the ally hit by the triggering attack roll can spend a healing surge, healing an additional number of hit points equal to 5 + your Wisdom modifier.

Armor of Storms.name: Armor of Storms
Armor of Storms.flavor: You wreathe your ally in elemental lightning, transforming his or her armor into a battery of arcane energy.
Armor of Storms.effect: You infuse the target’s armor with an elemental lightning spirit. Until the end of the encounter, the target gains resist 15 lightning. In addition, you can use the Armor of Storms Attack power once per round until the end of the encounter if the primary target is within 5 squares of you.
Armor of Storms.requirement: The power Armor of Storms must be active in order to use this power.
Armor of Storms.secondaryOnHit: 1d10 + Intelligence modifier lightning damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn. Each enemy adjacent to the secondary target takes lightning damage equal to 5 + your implement’s enhancement bonus.

Brittle Frost.name: Brittle Frost
Brittle Frost.flavor: You freeze your enemy with a chilling cold, making it hard for it to attack effectively while transferring its lost potential to your allies.
Brittle Frost.effect: The target is weakened (save ends). As long as the target is weakened by this effect, all your allies within 5 squares of the target gain a +5 power bonus to damage rolls.

Retribution Magnet.name: Retribution Magnet
Retribution Magnet.flavor: You weave enchantments of revenge and retribution on your weapon, firing off a quick shot to punish those that would hurt your allies.
Retribution Magnet.trigger: An enemy hits and deals damage to one of your allies with an attack
Retribution Magnet.onHit: 3[W] + Intelligence modifier force damage, and the ally targeted by the triggering attack gains a +4 power bonus to attack rolls against the target until the end of your next turn.

Vitality Siphon.name: Vitality Siphon
Vitality Siphon.flavor: You drain the life energy from your enemy, infusing your allies with their lost health.
Vitality Siphon.onHit: 3d8 + Intelligence necrotic modifier damage. Until the end of your next turn, each time the target takes damage, chose an ally within 5 squares of the target. That ally gains temporary hit points equal to 10 + your Wisdom modifier.

Auramorphic Armor.name: Auramorphic Armor
Auramorphic Armor.flavor: You transform your ally’s armor into a shifting field of arcane energy that protects your ally from a variety of attacks.
Auramorphic Armor.effect: You infuse the target’s armor with dynamic, variable energy. Until the end of the encounter, the target gains resist 20 to any one damage type of your choice. In addition, you can use the Auramoprhic Armor Attack power once per round until the end of the encounter if the primary target is within 5 squares of you.
Auramorphic Armor.secondaryeffect: The target takes 1d10 + Intelligence modifier damage of the type you selected when you cast auramorphic armor, and until the end of your next turn the target cannot attack the primary target.

Tactical Detonation.name: Tactical Detonation
Tactical Detonation.flavor: You fire a precision shot carrying an explosive enchantment, which hurls enemies directly into the path of your attacking allies.
Tactical Detonation.onHit: 4[W] + Intelligence modifier fire and force damage.
Tactical Detonation.secondaryTarget: Each enemy adjacent to the primary target.
Tactical Detonation.secondaryOnHit: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier fire and force damage, and slide the target 4 squares. If the target ends its movement adjacent to one of your allies, that ally can make a melee basic attack against the target as a free action. Each target can be attacked by only one of your allies as a result of this power.

Radiant Forcefield.name: Radiant Forcefield
Radiant Forcefield.flavor: You bestow an enchantment of radiant energy upon the armor of your ally, warding them against oncoming attackers.
Radiant Forcefield.effect: The target takes radiant damage equal to 10 + your implement’s enhancement bonus and grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.
Radiant Forcefield.requirement: The power Radiant Forcefield must be active in order to use this power.

Phantasmal Henchman.name: Phantasmal Henchman
Phantasmal Henchman.flavor: What relief your enemy might have found in evading your ally’s attack is suddenly dashed when it notices an identical figure standing nearby.
Phantasmal Henchman.trigger: An ally within 10 squares of you misses an enemy with an attack.
Phantasmal Henchman.effect: You conjure a phantasmal henchman in an unoccupied square adjacent to the target of the triggering ally’s attack. The phantasmal henchman remains until the end of your next turn. Your allies can flank with the phantasmal henchman. As a move action, you can move the conjuration 6 squares. Once before the end of your next turn, the phantasmal henchman can use the Phantasmal Henchman Attack power.
Phantasmal Henchman.requirement: The power Phantasmal Henchman must be active in order to use this power.
Phantasmal Henchman.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target grants combat advantage to all attackers until the end of its next turn.

Ice Shard Traps.name: Ice Shard Traps
Ice Shard Traps.flavor: You spread invisible patches of ice on the battlefield. When your enemies stumble into the traps, a hail of crystals erupts around them.
Ice Shard Traps.effect: You conjure two ice shard traps in two different unoccupied squares on the ground within the burst. The traps are invisible to your enemies and last until the end of your next turn. When an enemy enters a trap’s square, make the following attack against that enemy as a free action. Then the trap disappears.
Ice Shard Traps.onHit: 1d8 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and the target gains vulnerable 5 cold and grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.

Shadowy Figurine.name: Shadowy Figurine
Shadowy Figurine.flavor: Your magic creates an ebon figurine cloaked in shadow. Tendrils of dim light stretch from the figurine and envelop you and your allies in obscurity.
Shadowy Figurine.effect: You conjure a shadowy figurine in a square within ange. The figurine lasts until the end of your next turn. While within 2 squares of the figurine, you and your allies gain partial concealment and a +4 power bonus to Stealth checks.
Shadowy Figurine.sustainMinor: The figurine persists until the end of your next turn, and you can move it up to 5 squares.

Smokepowder Blast.name: Smokepowder Blast
Smokepowder Blast.flavor: You hurl a vial of black powder at your enemy’s feet, creating a fiery explosion. One of your allies takes advantage of the confusion and strikes while your opponent’s guard is down.
Smokepowder Blast.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and ongoing 5 fire damage (save ends).
Smokepowder Blast.effect: One of your allies adjacent to the target can make a melee basic attack against it as a free action. If your attack hit the target, the ally gains a power bonus to his or her attack roll equal to your Constitution or Wisdom modifier.

Arc Infusion.name: Arc Infusion
Arc Infusion.flavor: Lightning from your attack leaps to a nearby ally, infusing him or her with arcane energy, before streaking back and disorienting your foe.
Arc Infusion.onHit: 1[W] + Intelligence modifier lightning damage, and one ally within 5 squares of the target can make a saving throw with a power bonus equal to your Wisdom modifier. If the ally saves, the target takes 5 extra lightning damage and is dazed until the end of your next turn.

Sigil of Admixture.name: Sigil of Admixture
Sigil of Admixture.flavor: You inscribe an arcane symbol on the weapon, imbuing it with a particular kind of energy.
Sigil of Admixture.effect: Choose acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, or thunder. Until the end of your next turn, any attack made using the target deals 1d6 extra damage of the chosen type.

Siphon Fate.name: Siphon Fate
Siphon Fate.flavor: Your arcane strikes draw fortune’s boon from your opponents, and you surround a nearby companion with a nimbus of luck.
Siphon Fate.onHit: 1[W] + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls and saving throws until the end of your next turn.
Siphon Fate.effect: Until the end of your next turn, one ally within 5 squares of you gains a power bonus to attack rolls and saving throws equal to 2 + the number of targets you hit with this power.

Synchronized Weaponry.name: Synchronized Weaponry
Synchronized Weaponry.flavor: You forge a mystical link between your weapon and that of your comrade’s. Whenever one weapon strikes a foe, the other responds in kind.
Synchronized Weaponry.effect: When the target hits an enemy with a weapon attack, you can use an arcane at-will attack power that has the weapon keyword against the same enemy as an immediate reaction. When you hit an enemy with a weapon attack, the target can make a basic attack with a weapon against the same enemy as an immediate reaction. This effect lasts until the end of your next turn.
Synchronized Weaponry.sustainMinor: The effect persists until the end of your next turn.

Coiled Spring Traps.name: Coiled Spring Traps
Coiled Spring Traps.flavor: You mine the battlefield with giant invisible springs. When your foes step onto them, the coils play havoc with their forward progress.
Coiled Spring Traps.effect: You conjure three coiled spring traps in three different unoccupied squares on the ground within range. The traps are invisible to your enemies and last until the end of your next turn. When an enemy enters a trap’s square, make the following attack against that enemy as a free action. Then, the trap disappears.
Coiled Spring Traps.onHit: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier force damage, and you slide the target up to 5 squares and knock it prone. The target takes a penalty to AC and Fortitude equal to your Constitution or Wisdom modifier until the end of your next turn.

Armor of Darkness.name: Armor of Darkness
Armor of Darkness.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Armor of Darkness.flavor: Your armor is imbued with a tenebrous and chaotic shadow, which lashes out in defense, sapping your foes’ life force to bolster your own.
Armor of Darkness.onHit: 1d6 + Intelligence modifier cold and necrotic damage.
Armor of Darkness.effect: You and each ally adjacent to you gain 5 temporary hit points.
